header.title: How To Study Enochian Magic: A Special Report from The Institute for Hermetic Studies

central_thesis: This report provides a progressive, structured, and accessible approach to studying and practicing Enochian magic, addressing common misconceptions regarding its dangers and emphasizing intellectual and theoretical preparation as a prerequisite for practical ceremonial work. It synthesizes various viewpoints to make the system understandable and useful for personal spiritual growth, advocating a balanced approach to the Elemental Tablets and Aethyrs.

structure_content.summary: Introduces Enochian magic, its prominent figures (Dee, Kelly, Mathers, Crowley), and the common problems students face, including beliefs about its danger or demonic nature. The report aims to suggest practical ways to study Enochian magic for spiritual growth, expounding upon and synthesizing existing ideas.
Outlines the main topics covered: the role of Enochian in modern magic, a progressive study approach for Watchtowers and Aethyrs, and an examination of suitable rituals.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Role of Enochian in Modern Magic
structure_content.summary: Discusses the diverse methods of using Enochian magic and the varying opinions on when to begin its study. It contrasts Paul Foster Case's warning of danger with Lon Milo DuQuette's view of it as a 'safest, cleanest, most logical system,' and Israel Regardie's emphasis on thorough preparation.

Lists the essential materials required for studying Enochian magic, including copies of Elemental Tablets, Tablet of Union, 19 Calls, 30 Aethyrs, Sigillium Dei Emeth, and dedicated notebooks for recording experiences and technical notes.

Suggests a structured study plan, including foundational rituals like the Lesser Banishing Rituals and a progressive series of operations: Operation of the 14/18 Days, Meditation on the Tablet of Union, Enochian Cube of Space, and opening the Elemental Tablets before advancing to the Aethyrs.

Recommends a specific invocation from 'The Book of the Concourse of Forces' to be recited before any Enochian work, involving names derived from the Tablet of Union and the First Enochian Call, linking to Chesed and the Three Supernals on the Tree of Life.

Describes a foundational 14 or 18-day ritual involving placing the Tablet of Union and Elemental Tablets, then invoking and binding the major parts of the Enochian hierarchy. It highlights the importance of experiencing the entire system in its original context and experimenting with Dee's vs. Golden Dawn elemental orientations.

structure_content.chapter_title: Meditation on the Tablet of Union
structure_content.summary: Emphasizes the Tablet of Union as the core of the Enochian universe, representing a synthesis of elemental powers. Meditation on it and invoking its primary angel EHNB is crucial for making future work with Elemental Tablets more effective, suggesting 1-3 months for this practice.

Explains the Enochian Cube of Space as a three-dimensional astral matrix, visualizing the Tablet of Union for ceiling/floor and Elemental Tablets for walls. This exercise aids familiarity with the Enochian gateway and its holographic form, linking to Golden Dawn 'Supreme Convocation of the Watchtowers' ritual, also suggesting 1-3 months of practice.
Presents the Tablet of Earth as a model for working with all Elemental Tablets (Earth-Water-Air-Fire or Earth-Air-Water-Fire ordering). The process serves as a template for elemental work.

Details the invocation of Seniors, which represent planetary energies directed through the Elements. It suggests using the hexagram ritual or visualizing letters of the Senior's name in planetary colors, vibrating the name to bring its energy into the 'Sphere of Sensation.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Invoking the Subquarters of the Elemental Tablets
structure_content.summary: Describes subquarters as microcosms within microcosms, showing how each element contains aspects of others. It links subquarters to Zodiacal Signs (Golden Dawn) and Tarot, enabling specific invocations (e.g., Fire of Earth for Capricorn energy) to influence practical outcomes.

structure_content.chapter_title: Invoking of the Calvary Cross as Sepheroth of the Tree of Life
structure_content.summary: Explains the Calvary Cross within each Subquarter as representing Tree of Life Sephirothic influences. It notes that invoking the two ruling angels of the Cross is generally sufficient, as lesser entities are too specific to be consciously active for most practitioners.

Advises extreme caution with Cadecodemons due to their unruly and destructive nature, suggesting this area of work is only for experienced ceremonial magicians, ideally with prior goetic experience and guidance from one's Holy Guardian Angel.

structure_content.chapter_title: Explore the Vast Array of Association of the Golden Dawn
structure_content.summary: Highlights the Golden Dawn's complex attributions to Enochian squares, including Elemental attributes beyond Dee-Kelly's letters. It explains the 'quartering' of squares into truncated pyramids with Egyptian deities, and analyzes the Elemental ratios within the Tablet of Union's words (EHNB and others).

Positions Aethyr skrying as the simplest and most important Enochian practice, representing subtle spiritual energies and consciousness. It is equated with 'Rising on the Planes' for expanding awareness and achieving 'Knowledge and Conversation' with one's Holy Guardian Angel, making it a focal point for spiritual growth.

Explores several points for individual research: the Tablet of Union as an amplification device, Enochian's lunar and Yetziric/Assiah bias due to sound emphasis (Lavanah/Moon connection), its nature as an 'Air system' (affecting fundamental organization through sound), and the crucial role of Thoth-Hermes as the 'Lord of the Word' in Golden Dawn/Enochian magic.

Discusses the availability and preference for colorized Elemental Tablets, suggesting online suppliers (e.g., New Falcon Press) and resources like 'The Ritual Magic Manual' by David Griffin and 'Enochian Magick: The Practice of Angelic Evocation' video for practical demonstrations.

structure_content.chapter_title: What To Expect – Journaling is Your Friend
structure_content.summary: Emphasizes the necessity of keeping a complete record (journaling) of Enochian experiments due to its personal bias and unique impact on dream life, which often reveals recurring themes, symbols, motion, transportation, and structures (squares, rectangles, cubes), acting as guides for further operations.

Mentions other forms beyond Tablets and Aethyrs, such as working with Sigillum Dei Aemeth, Twelve Gates, Planetary Angels of the Bonorum, Heptarchia Mystica, and Tabula Sancta. It recommends Pat Zalewski's 'Golden Dawn Enochian Magic' and John Dee's 'Five Books of Mystery' for further study.

Reiterates that Enochian is not for beginners, stressing that Dee, Kelly, Mathers, and Crowley were already highly skilled practitioners. It argues that problems arise from the operator's ill-preparedness or desire for shortcuts/mundane gains, not the system itself. Emphasizes theoretical understanding before practical application for genuine spiritual growth.

Condenses the report's key findings: conflicting views but wide use of Enochian; Golden Dawn's view of it as powerful/dangerous requiring preparation vs. modern views of it as user-friendly; power from sound/pronunciation; varied pronunciation schools; minimal tools needed; usable standalone or adjunct; deceptively simple requiring study plan; focus on Elemental Tablets and Aethyrs; multiple revisions of Tablets; Tablets affect material world/inner landscape, Aethyrs expand consciousness; importance of balancing work between them; necessity of journaling.

structure_content.chapter_title: Appendix One – Simple Opening For The Tablet of Earth
structure_content.summary: Provides a step-by-step simple ritual for opening the Tablet of Earth, including Lesser Banishing Rituals, invoking the Three Fold Name over the Tablet, reciting the Fifth Key, meditation, and a license to depart.

structure_content.chapter_title: Appendix Two – Standard Opening for the Tablet of Earth
structure_content.summary: Presents a more elaborate, Golden Dawn-based ritual for opening the Tablet of Earth, drawing from Crowley's Liber Chanock. It includes Lesser Banishing Rituals, purification, adoration of the King of Earth, specific invocations to various angels and entities, and recitation of the Fifth Key, followed by meditation and closing.

structure_content.chapter_title: Appendix Three – Simple Invocation of a Senior
structure_content.summary: Offers a template for invoking a Senior after opening the Tablet of Earth (using either Appendix One or Two). It provides Enochian and English translations of the invocation, emphasizing the importance of operator understanding and developing a 'Magic Personality' with commanding but compassionate resonance.

structure_content.chapter_title: Appendix Four – Opening of a Sub-Quarter
structure_content.summary: Explains that addressing angels of sub-quarters requires attention to Enochian hierarchy, starting with the Three Fold Name, King, all six Seniors, and two Divine Names from the Calvary Cross. It notes that additional angels (Calvary Crosses, Kerubic, Lesser Angels) can be added if the practitioner has already worked with the Tablets, Kings, and Seniors individually.

key_concepts.definition: A complex system of ceremonial magic, often considered a powerful operative system, originally revealed to Dr. John Dee and Edward Kelly. It utilizes elemental tablets, calls, and Aethyrs for spiritual communication and manipulation of subtle energies.

Four primary tablets (Earth, Water, Air, Fire) forming the basis of Enochian magic, representing the material and etheric energies of creation. They are extensions of the Tablet of Union and contain hierarchies of angels, Seniors, and subquarters.
The core and central piece of the Enochian universe, synthesizing all powers of the Elemental Tablets. It is crucial for initial meditation and understanding, with its ruling angel EHNB.

Thirty distinct planes or levels representing subtle spiritual energies that give rise to consciousness. Skrying the Aethyrs is considered the most important practice for expanding awareness and achieving 'Knowledge and Conversation' with one's Holy Guardian Angel, analogous to 'Rising on the Planes' in Qabalah.

A complex magical seal related to Enochian practices, often used in conjunction with the Holy Table for skrying. Its reverse side is inscribed with 'Lavanah' (Moon), suggesting a lunar connection for certain operations.

Entities on the Elemental Tablets representing planetary energies directed through the Elements. Their invocation typically involves hexagram rituals and visualization of their names in planetary colors.
A cross surrounded by additional squares within each Elemental Subquarter, representing the influences of the Sephiroth of the Tree of Life. Invoking its ruling angels directs the subordinate angels.

Unruly, destructive, or mischievous entities described in some Enochian traditions. The report strongly advises against working with them due to confusion and potential dangers, recommending only highly experienced magicians with prior goetic experience.
A Golden Dawn term referring to the magician's aura or subtle energetic field into which invoked energies are directed during ritual practice.

key_concepts.term: Knowledge and Conversation of the Holy Guardian Angel (K&C)
key_concepts.definition: A central goal of advanced magical practice, particularly emphasized in Thelema and Golden Dawn traditions, representing direct spiritual communion with one's higher self or true will. Skrying the Aethyrs is presented as a path to this experience.

Two of the four Qabalistic worlds: Yetzirah (Formation/Astral) and Assiah (Action/Material). The report suggests Enochian magic, particularly the Elemental Tablets, may primarily operate on these levels, influencing practical and mundane affairs, and that sound/vibration are key to Yetziric influence.

Referred to as the 'Lord of the Word' and central to Golden Dawn higher grades. Invocation of Thoth and assumption of its godform is considered fundamental for all magical work, especially evocations and talismans, providing order in chaos, accumulation of knowledge, and a link to spirit consciousness and the Collective Unconscious.

practical_system.description: The proposed practical system for studying Enochian magic is progressive and emphasizes thorough theoretical understanding and foundational ritual work before advancing to more complex operations. It starts with establishing a stable magical environment and building familiarity with core Enochian components. The system encourages personal experimentation and journaling to integrate experiences and develop a 'Magic Personality,' aiming for spiritual growth and 'Knowledge and Conversation' with one's Holy Guardian Angel.
tools: Copies of the Elemental Tablets (preferably colorized)
A copy of the Sigillium Dei Emeth (helpful)
A notebook for recording experiences and operations
A notebook for writing out hierarchies, Calls, technical notes
Elemental tools (wand, lotus wand, Pantacle of Earth)
rituals: Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram
Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Hexagram
Preliminary Invocation ('I will reign over you...')
Operation of the 14/18 Days (invoking and binding Enochian hierarchy)
Meditation on the Tablet of Union (and invoking angel EHNB)
Enochian Cube of Space (visualization of Elemental Tablets and Tablet of Union)
Opening the Tablet of Earth (template for other Elemental Tablets)
Invoking the Seniors (using hexagram and planetary colors)
Invoking the Subquarters of the Elemental Tablets (linking to Zodiacal Signs and Tarot)
Invoking of the Calvary Cross as Sepheroth of the Tree of Life
Simple Opening For The Tablet of Earth (Appendix One)
Standard Opening for the Tablet of Earth (from Liber Chanock, Appendix Two)
Simple Invocation of a Senior (template, Appendix Three)

relevant_quotes.text: Perhaps a word or two of caution might be added. Undoubtedly prudence is required in this matter (the study of Enochian). It is a very powerful system, and if used carelessly and indiscriminately will bring about disaster and spiritual disintegration. The warnings given in connection with the Invocations are not to be regarded as conventions or as platitudinous moralizings. They represent a knowledge of true facts, and the student will do well to take cognizance thereof. Let him study the theory first of all, so that he has a thorough knowledge of the construction of the squares and pyramids. This must be so ingrained within his mind, that a glance at the Tablets will automatically start an associative current which will bring up without delay the attributions of any given letter or square which strikes the eye. Only when this has been accomplished, dare he venture to the actual usage of the Pyramids with the God-forms, or the employment of the Invocations in ceremonial.

“I have found the Enochian system to be the safest, cleanest and most logical system of practical magick one can perform. But it is an art and as such requires not only study and practice but also inspiration and the love-hate relationship all artists have with their craft.

The Magical Will is in its essence twofold, for it presupposes a beginning and an end; to Will to be a thing is to admit that you are not that thing. Hence to Will anything but the supreme thing [Knowledge and Conversation with one's Holy Guardian Angel], is to wander still further from it – any Will but that to give up the self to the Beloved is Black Magic [bold original]– yet this surrender is so simple an act that to our complex minds it is the most difficult of all acts; and hence training is necessary.

“I will reign over you, saith the God of Justice. O Lexarph, Comanan, Tabitom. Move, therefore, and show yourselves forth and appear; declare unto us the mysteries of your Creation, the Balance of Righteousness and Truth.”

“It's sonics. Sound-vibration is the basis of the universe. All those little vortices may get sent going the other way. Sound is really very powerful. We haven't gotten quite to grips with that now. I know for fact that there are defense systems based on sonics.

critical_analysis.relevance: This report is highly relevant for both novice and intermediate practitioners of Enochian magic within Western Esotericism. It effectively contextualizes Enochian magic by tracing its lineage through Dr. Dee, the Golden Dawn, and Aleister Crowley, while also integrating modern perspectives. Its primary strength lies in synthesizing conflicting views on Enochian's safety and offering a clear, progressive, and structured study plan. By emphasizing intellectual groundwork and a 'Make Haste Slowly' approach, it serves as a crucial counterpoint to superficial or reckless engagement with this powerful system. The detailed practical steps for foundational rituals, elemental work, and Aethyr skrying provide a coherent pathway, addressing the common problem of fragmentation in Enochian studies. The analysis of Enochian's 'Air System' nature and the importance of Thoth-Hermes offers a deeper theoretical understanding of its operative mechanics.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes serious students of Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly those interested in Enochian magic, Qabalah, and Golden Dawn traditions. It is ideal for beginners who seek a structured, safe, and progressive introduction to Enochian magic, as it outlines the necessary foundational work before engaging in more advanced practices. Experienced magicians may also find value in its synthesis of different schools of thought, its emphasis on balanced practice between Elemental Tablets and Aethyrs, and its practical appendices for ritual execution. Individuals seeking to integrate Enochian magic into their existing magical systems will appreciate its insights into its adaptable and 'high-octane fuel' nature, while those concerned about the system's reputation for danger will find reassurance in its call for disciplined preparation and self-awareness.
